note.p: Death: His house in South Lambeth, London (29 May 1785)
Burial: North side of the altar of St Katharine's-by-the-Tower, London

Education: Eton College; Trinity College, Oxford (matriculated 1731); Gray's Inn (admitted 1732); Inner Temple (admitted 1735); St John's College, Oxford; BCL (1738), DCL (1742); Incorporated LLB at Cambridge (from Trinity Hall) (1739)
Career: Admitted advocate (1743); official of the Diocese of Canterbury (1758); Lambeth Librarian (1757)
